intro: Dolicholobium seruiense, commonly known as the Serui dolicholobium, is a rare flowering plant native to the island of Serui in Indonesia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its elongated, lobed leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It typically grows in humid, tropical environments and is adapted to thrive in shaded undergrowth. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
